content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, 12 x, minus x cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the absolute minimum value of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 3, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 5.5: Using the Candidates Test to Determine Absolute (Global) Extrema
